title: Drugs US: are prices too high?: measuring international pharmaceutical price differences
abstract: There is a widespread view that prices for drugs in the United States are much higher than elsewhere. Is this true? Panos Kanavos and Sotiris Vandoros find that much depends on what you look at: you have to compare like with like
